intro: Neochilenia pulchella, commonly known as the beautiful neochilenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. This grass-like plant typically grows in grasslands and open habitats, often in areas with well-drained soils. Neochilenia pulchella is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, narrow leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are arranged in spikelets, typical of the grass family.
